wikipedia_page.main:
Charles John Kemeys Tynte or Charles Kemeys-Tynte FRS (9 April 1800 — 16 September 1882) was an English Liberal politician who sat in the House of Commons in two periods between 1832 and 1865.
Tynte was the son of Charles Kemeys Kemeys-Tynte, and his wife Anne Leyson. He was a colonel in the Royal Glamorgan regiment. He was also elected a Fellow of the Royal Society in 1834.At the 1832 general election, Tynte was elected Member of Parliament for West Somerset. He held the seat until 1837.  In 1847 he was elected MP for Bridgwater. He held the seat until 1865.Tynte died at the age of 82.
Tynte married Elizabeth Swinnerton (daughter of Thomas Swinnerton) on 18 July 1820. He married again, to Vincentia Brabazon (daughter of Wallop Brabazon) on 15 Apr 1841 in Leamington Priors.

response: *Charles Kemeys-Tynte (1778–1860), English Whig and Liberal politician
